data.title: Adam Fisher - Men's Golf

Adam Fisher

Bio

Related

Historical

Biography

2016-17: A staple in the Bears scorecard, playing in all 11 tournaments and averaging 73.23 … Finished tied for 12th to start the season at the UNO Invitational (Sept. 3-4), shooting 76-73-87 for 222 over three rounds … Tied for second at the UMKC/Bill Ross Invitational (Oct. 3-4) … Carded 70-69-72--211 for his lowest game of the fall, and third lowest of the season … Led the Bears in three tournaments from Feb. 25-Mar. 20 … Posted his lowest round of his college career at the Loyola Intercollegiate (Feb. 25-27) with a 66 in the second round on the way to an eighth place finish with 210 … Placed second at the Twin Oaks Intercollegiate (Mar. 20-21), firing off 68-71-69--208, a season and career tournament low.

2015-16: Enjoyed an outstanding first collegiate season, finishing the fall ninth in the Missouri Valley Conference with a 74.27 scoring average... Placed third in his second tournament, the USD Coyote Classic, where he fired 80-73-69--222...Tied for eighth at the SIUE Derek Dolenc Invitational, carding 72-70-70--212, four-under par...Shot 73-75-78--226 in his collegiate debut at the Weibring Intercollegiate to tie for 34th...Tied for 46th at the fall finale at Austin Peay with 76-70-75--221... Finished in the top 20 at the Loyola Intercollegiate shooting 70-70-73--213 … Tied for 12th in the Twin Oaks Intercollegiate, firing 75-74-74--223 … Wrapped up the Spring pacing the Bears in the ORU Shootout with 76-74-74--224 to tie for 14th.

Background: Had a decorated junior career in the United Kingdom, winning the prestigious Paul Lawrie Junior Jug in 2014 at Ladybank Golf Club, finishing two-under par for 54 holes...Also qualified for the 2013 British Boys Championship at Royal Liverpool/Wallasey, making the top 64 of the match play event and advancing to the round of 16...A member of the Scottish national team, he finished in the top 20 of the Under-16 stroke play in 2011...Also won the 2012 Scottish Winter Series final at St. Andrew's before helping Scotland defeat England, Ireland and Wales in a quadrangular event.

Personal: Born December 18, 1996, in Aberdeen, Scotland ... Son of Gavin and Sharon Fisher ... Studying General Business at Missouri State.
